intro: Margyricarpus laevis, commonly known as the smooth margyricarpus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It produces a unique type of fruit called a cypsela, which is typically smooth and ribbed. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
